item.title: Katie add a quote by Jean Vanier
item.description: "Many people are good at talking about what they are doing, but in fact do little. Others do a lot but don't talk about it; they are the ones who make a community live." -- Jean Vanier

item.title: Katie add a quote by Brother Lawrence
item.description: "We ought not to be weary of doing little things for the love of God, who regards not the greatness of the work, but the love with which it is performed." -- Brother Lawrence

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jean Vanier
item.description: "Every human activity can be put at the service of the divine and of love. We should all exercise our gift to build community." -- Jean Vanier

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "[A]lthough the principle of equality has always been self-evident, it has never been self-executing." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Katie add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Tenderness and kindness are not signs of weakness and despair, but manifestations of strength and resolution." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dorothy Day
item.description: "You will know your vocation by the joy that it brings you. You will know. You will know when it's right." -- Dorothy Day

item.title: Katie add a quote by Jean Vanier
item.description: "When people love each other, they are content with very little. When we have light and joy in our hearts, we don't need material wealth. The most loving communities are often the poorest. If our own life is luxurious and wasteful, we can't approach poor people. If we love people, we want to identify with them and share with them." -- Jean Vanier

item.title: Katie add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Katie add a quote by Daphne Rae
item.description: "I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love." -- Daphne Rae

item.title: Katie add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "I have decided to stick to love...Hate is too great a burden to bear." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Katie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis
